page.title: 03CHURCH FETE - WICHENFORD
page.content: On a warm sunny Saturday afternoon in June, the {St. Laurence Church garden {fete}was held at{Wichenford Court.} The{Salvation Army}band provided a festive atmosphere as people of all ages arrived to take part in the day's activities. {Stalls}surrounded the lawn, selling a variety of goods: garden produce, home baking, packet goods and newly picked strawberries with fresh farm cream. For the youngsters there were{games and{competitions}with small entry fees in aid of the church. We could{ride a {pony, pluck a duck, fell skittles,}or {win a raffle;}and for the adults there was a{tombola}with an amazing variety of alcoholic prizes. An{ice cream van}and{tea room}were doing brisk trade. There were{floral {competitions}too. Everyone was happy and taking full part in the festivity.
